results.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill thinks media criticism of Austin MacPhee is unfair and backs his former assistant to be Tynecastle director of football.
results.title: Hearts: Austin MacPhee 'wouldn't be given fair chance' as head coach - Michael O'Neill

results.description: Austin MacPhee "has to be considered" for the Hearts manager's job, says former Tynecastle player Gary Mackay.
results.title: Hearts 'must consider' MacPhee, says club great Gary Mackay

results.description: Read the 12 takeaways from this weekend's Scottish Premiership action.
results.title: Scottish Premiership: What did we learn from the weekend's games?

results.description: Rangers left-back Borna Barisic was on fine form against Livingston, with a superb through ball before attempting a powerful shot during his side's 2-0 victory.
results.shortTitle: Watch: How did that not go in from Barisic?
results.title: Watch: Rangers' Borna Barisic hits wonderful shot, but how does it not go in?

thumbnail.altText: Barisic hits wonderful shot against Livi

results.description: Hamilton were held to a 2-2 draw by 10-men Kilmarnock but one positive to come from the game was this incredible long-range goal from forward Mickel Miller.
results.title: Watch: Miller nets long-range thriller for Hamilton

results.description: Hearts comfortably overcame St Mirren 5-2 on Saturday, with the second goal coming from an unfortunate own goal by Sean McLoughlin in the first half.
results.shortTitle: Watch: St Mirren go behind to comical own goal
results.title: Watch: St Mirren go behind to a comical own goal against Hearts

results.description: Celtic consider a January move for former Bayern Munich midfielder Niklas Dorsch as Hearts welcome Steven Naismith's Scotland call-up after fitness talks.
results.title: Scottish Gossip: Celtic, Rangers, Hearts, Naismith, Hayes, Aberdeen, Motherwell, Kilmarnock, Gallagher, Dorsch, Heidenheim

results.description: Goals from Joe Aribo and Alfredo Morelos give Rangers victory over Livingston to keep them level on points with leaders Celtic. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Livingston 0-2 Rangers

results.description: Celtic beat Motherwell to remain top of the Scottish Premiership going into the international break. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Celtic 2-0 Motherwell

results.description: Hearts, under caretaker manager Austin MacPhee, pick up their first home win since March as they put five goals past St Mirren. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Heart of Midlothian 5-2 St Mirren

results.description: Managerless Hibernian hammer St Johnstone with Christian Doidge netting a hat-trick. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: St Johnstone 1-4 Hibernian

results.description: Despite an early red card, Hamilton hold on for more than an hour to take a point from Kilmarnock. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Kilmarnock 2-2 Hamilton Academical

results.description: Aberdeen make it three wins from three despite the loss of an early goal against Ross County. (UK only)
results.title: Highlights: Ross County 1-3 Aberdeen

results.description: Celtic manager Neil Lennon says John Kennedy "won't be going anywhere" amid reports his assistant is on a shortlist to become Hibernian head coach.
results.title: John Kennedy: Neil Lennon says assistant staying at Celtic amid Hibs link

results.description: Steven Gerrard feels Livingston head coach Gary Holt was wide of the mark with criticism of him after the Rangers boss called for better protection for players.
results.title: Livingston 0-2 Rangers: Steven Gerrard questions Gary Holt's pre-match remarks

results.description: Rangers remain level on points with Celtic at the top of the Scottish Premiership after beating Livingston at the Tony Macaroni Arena.
results.shortTitle: Rangers beat Livi to stay level at top
results.title: Livingston 0-2 Rangers: Steven Gerrard's side remain level at top of table

results.description: Odsonne Edouard opens the scoring and Richard Tait adds an own goal as Celtic beat Motherwell to remain top of the Premiership.
results.shortTitle: Celtic defeat Motherwell to stay top
results.title: Celtic 2-0 Motherwell: Champions win to stay top of the Premiership

thumbnail.altText: Odsonne Edouard celebrates opening the scoring at Celtic Park

results.description: Christian Doidge admits his confidence had "gone a little bit" before his hat-trick fired managerless Hibernian to a 4-1 rout of St Johnstone.
results.title: Hibernian: Christian Doidge confidence had 'gone a little' before hat-trick

thumbnail.altText: Hibernian players celebrate Christian Doidge's goal against St Johnstone

results.description: English Premier League club line up cut price bid for Celtic midfielder, Livingston upset by Rangers boss comments...
results.title: Scottish Gossip: Celtic, Rangers, Livingston, Steven Gerrard, Neil Lennon, Lawrence Shankland

results.description: Shorn of some his best talent, Livingston boss Gary Holt faced a summer rebuild to keep the club in the Scottish Premiership. The numbers suggest he is doing a fine job.
results.shortTitle: Can Livingston continue to punch above their weight?
results.title: Livingston: Can Gary Holt keep all-action club punching above its weight?
